column2: The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.
The greatest of the hippogryphs for the greatest Bretonnian leader since Gilles the Uniter.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or dragon!
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Fierce beasts that will fight to the death any who enter their territory – be they man or dragon!
Covered in heavy barding and spikes, to tear the flesh of their foes.
Driven mad by the stench of blood, they are eager to trample their prey into the dirt.
Powerful Dark Magic saturated the bones of long-dead dragons, raising them to new purpose.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Driven mad by the stench of blood, they are eager to trample their prey into the dirt.

A coal-black charger, with Daemonic ichor for blood.
Once noble rulers of the skies, now corrupt with change.

Once noble rulers of the skies, now corrupt with change.
The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.
Hailing from deep within the forests of the Old World, this dragon breathes deadly, poisonous fumes instead of fire.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.
The barded steeds of the nobles are the greatest chargers from a nation that prides itself on its equestrian pedigree.
The unnatural speed and brutality of a reanimated Promethean makes it the ideal mount for any Undead, battle-mongering pirate.
A magnet to Dark Magic, the cart draws power from the land to raise the dead or improve their fighting prowess.
Some corpse carts have a great bell mounted upon them, its ominous knell drawing the dead back to shambling Unlife.
Its brazier burning with supernatural flames, the cart spits Warpstone – and the madness therein – upon enemy Wizards in its path.

Driven mad by the stench of blood, they are eager to trample their prey into the dirt.

A leonine beast of blinding rage and the perfect mount for a Dark Lord, if it can be dominated.

The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.
Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!

Sculpted plates of thick, metal barding further protect these dark stallions.
Berserk killers saturated with primal fury; the God of Murder incarnate.
Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

Monstrous mounts that shatter bones with every swipe of their tails and sink scimitar-sized fangs deep into soft flesh.
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Arkhan’s winged chariot moves with supernatural speed as he scours the world in search of the enchanted items that will hasten the Great Necromancer’s return.
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.
Alberic's personal hippogryph, broken years prior when the duke was a young Knight Errant, is an especially fearsome specimen of an infamously savage species.
Stronger and faster than the mightiest warhorse, these intelligent beasts are exceptionally loyal to their noble masters.
Deadly giant bats the size of dragons, capable of plucking men from the field and stunning warhorses into paralysis.

Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

Amongst the largest and most ferocious of their race, the eldest Stegadons have thicker hide and larger horns than others of their kind.
